Name: Dendrites
Function: Dendrites are branch-like structures extending away from the cell body, and their job is to receive messages from other neurons and allow those messages to travel to the cell body.

Name: Cell Body
Function: Like other cells, each neuron has a cell body (or soma) that contains a nucleus, smooth and rough endoplasmic reticulum, Golgi apparatus, mitochondria, and other cellular components.

Name: Axon
Function: An axon, at its most basic, is a tube-like structure that carries an electrical impulse from the cell body

Name: Synapse
Function: The synapse is the chemical junction between the axon terminals of one neuron and the dendrites of the next.

Name: Myelin Sheath
Function: An external coating that functions as insulation to minimize dissipation of the electrical signal as it travels down the axon.
